# init(requiringSecureCoding:)

**Initializer**

Creates an archiver to encode data, and optionally disables secure coding.

## Declaration

```swift
init(requiringSecureCoding requiresSecureCoding: Bool)
```

## Parameters

- **requiresSecureCoding**: A Boolean value indicating whether all encoded objects must conform to [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSSecureCoding].

## Discussion

To prevent the possibility of encoding an object that [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSKeyedUnarchiver] can’t decode, set `requiresSecureCoding` to [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true] whenever possible. This ensures that all encoded objects conform to [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSSecureCoding].



## Related Documentation

- **requiresSecureCoding**: Indicates whether the archiver requires all archived classes to resist object substitution attacks.

## Creating a Keyed Archiver

- **init()**: Initializes an archiver to encode data.
- **init(forWritingWith:)**: Initializes an archiver to encode data into a given a mutable-data object.
